column5: Not much of a write-up. The link does have a photo however. Maybe it will be in tomorrow's paper?  http://www.nugget.ca/ArticleDisplay.aspx?e=2255914   Fishermen land 23-pound pike â€” PHOTO GALLERY Posted By Brent Roy (Photographer) Posted 12:20pm, Jan 11/2010  Dennis Roy holds a 41-inch, 23-pound pike he and Brent Roy caught at the North Bay waterfront Saturday at about 3 p.m. They caught it on a line with no lead and their own "special bait." It was their first day of ice fishing for the season.
It looks like they are fishing with hockey sticks...and by the looks of that guy...I believe he has a special bait
Kinda looks like kin of Tybo...
Nice catch, thought his zipper was a long string of pike slime at first.
The Sissy/Pansy fis of the GWN?... gimme a break!!!    For once I think you're actually right!!!     Say it aint true!!!... I thought there could only be one!
WHAT!!! I was fishing maybe 200 yards from them. That's crazy.
What, I resemble that remark. That's long lost Uncle Red Neck. 's
Wow I can't believe you guys are making fin of me
